Title: JPCERT warns of DslogdRAT malware deployed in Ivanti Connect Secure
Summary: The article discusses a zero-day vulnerability in Ivanti Connect Secure exploited by attackers deploying DslogdRAT malware, which communicates via XOR-encoded sockets and operates within specific hours to evade detection. This highlights the importance of advanced security measures and timely patch management. Organizations using Ivanti products, especially those handling sensitive data, are at risk and need robust cybersecurity solutions. Red Pepper Software can use this opportunity to help clients implement automated vulnerability scanning, real-time threat detection, and incident response systems. Rationale: Red Pepper Software can help security teams by providing automation and integration services to improve threat detection and response.

Title: SAP NetWeaver zero-day allegedly exploited by an initial access broker
Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-31324) in SAP NetWeaver has been exploited by attackers to upload malicious webshells, leading to potential full system compromise. The flaw involves improper authorization checks in the Metadata Uploader, allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute remote commands. Exploited by sophisticated threat actors, including initial access brokers, this vulnerability affects high-value enterprise systems used by governments and corporations. SAP released a security patch in April 2025, but many systems remain at risk. This situation underscores the need for continuous monitoring, rapid patching, and advanced detection capabilities. Red Pepper Software can help organizations implement automated security reporting, threat detection, and system modernization to mitigate such vulnerabilities and enhance overall cybersecurity resilience.
Rationale: Red Pepper Software can use this opportunity to offer automated security reporting and threat detection services for enterprise SAP environments.
